{{About|the television actor}} {{Infobox person | name = Shakeel | image = | imagesize = | caption = Shakeel | birth_name = Yusuf Kamal<ref name='PP' /><ref name="pakistanviews"/> | birth_date = 29 May 1938<ref name='PP' /> | birth_place = [[Bhopal]], [[British India]] (now [[India]]) | death_date = | death_place = | othername = | yearsactive = | spouse = | website = | notable role = Mehboob Ahmed in [[Aangan Terha]] and Urfi in [[Uncle Urfi]] }}
'''Shakeel''', born Yusuff Kamal (b: 1938), is a Pakistani [[Pakistan Television Corporation|television]] actor best known for his roles in [[Uncle Urfi]] and Mehboob Ahmed in [[Aangan Terha]]. He has also acted in a number of local [[Lollywood|films]] as well as an [[English film]], [[Butterflies are Free]]. He is also known for his philanthropic activities.
==Background== Shakeel and his family migrated to Karachi, Pakistan in 1952.<ref name='PP'>{{cite web | url = http://pakistaniprofiles.com/shakeel-actor | title = Shakeel- Actor | accessdate = 2011-04-07 | publisher = Pakistani Profiles.com}}</ref>
He received his primary education from an English medium school in prepartition India and a French missionary school in India.<ref name="pakistanviews"/>
==Career== ===Films=== He made his debut in the film, ''Honehar'' in 1966.<ref name="pakistanviews">[http://www.pakistanviews.com/shakeel-for-the-love-of-acting Shakeel: For the love of acting] {{wayback|http://replay.waybackmachine.org/20090609154657/http://www.pakistanviews.com/shakeel-for-the-love-of-acting}}</ref> * Josh-e-intiqaam (1968) * Nakhuda (1968) * Papi (1968) * Zindigi (1968) * Dastaan (1969) * Insaan aur gadha (1973)<ref name='PD'>{{cite web | url = http://www.pakistanitvdrama.com/actors/shakeel-yusuf-kamal/ | title = Shakeel: For the love of acting | accessdate = 2011-04-07 | last = Shakur | first = Anis | publisher = Pakistani TV Drama}}</ref> * Badal aur bijli (1973)<ref name='PD' /> * Chahat (1973)<ref name='PD' /> * [[Butterflies are free]] (1977)<ref name='PD' /> * [[Jinnah (film)]] (1998) as [[Liaquat Ali Khan]]<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0183306/ Jinnah] '''IMDb'''</ref>
===Television=== Television roles:<ref>[http://www.ptv.com.pk/actor4.asp Shakeel TV and Film Actor]{{wayback|http://replay.waybackmachine.org/20090511122835/http://www.ptv.com.pk/actor4.asp}}</ref>
* Honeymoon * Tick Tick Company * Mantorama<ref name='PD' /> * Afshan<ref name='PD' /> * She jee<ref name='PD' /> * Zameen<ref name='PD' /> * Doosri Aurat<ref name='PD' /> * Aandhi<ref name='PD' /> * Tum say mil kar<ref name='PD' /> * Saaye<ref name='PD' /> * Jab Jab Dil Miley<ref name='PD' /> * [[Shehzori]]<ref name='PD' /> * Chaudhwee ka Chand<ref name='PD' /> * Colony 52<ref name='PD' /> * Dhoop Mein Sawan<ref name='PD' /> * Kothi No 156<ref name='PD' /> * Qutubuddins<ref name='PD' /> * Zer Zabar Pesh<ref name='PD' /> * Naam Dar<ref name='PD' /> * Ankahi <ref name='PD' /> * Anaa * Uroosa<ref name='PD' /> * Chand Grahan * Uraan<ref name='PD' /> * [[Uncle Urfi]]<ref name='PD' /> * Tappish. * Purchaiyan. * [[Aangan Terha]]
==Awards== In recognition of his contribution to show business, he was awarded the [[Pride of Performance]] in 1992.<ref name="pakistanviews"/>
